questions.text: What are the components of high-quality CPR? a) Compression rate 100-120/min b) Depth in adults 5-6cm c) ventilation 20-25 breaths/mins d) allow recoil
The MOST common complication associated with a Supraclavicular brachial plexus block is

options.label: B
options.text: Intravascular injection into the vertebral artery

options.label: C
options.text: Blockade of the recurrent laryngeal nerve

questions.correct_answer: A. Blockade of the phrenic nerve

questions.text: MATCH THE FOLLOWING:
Select the FALSE statement.

options.label: A
options.text: If a Magill forceps is used for a nasotracheal intubation, the right nares is preferable for insertion of the nasotracheal tube

options.label: B
options.text: Extension of the neck can convert an endotracheal intubation to an endobronchial intubation

options.label: C
options.text: Bucking signifies the return of the coughing reflex

options.label: D
options.text: Postintubation pharyngitis is more likely to occur in female patients

questions.correct_answer: B. Extension of the neck can convert an endotracheal intubation to an endobronchial intubation

questions.text: A case of head injury with SDH with high intracranial pressure to be going for surgical drainage which anesthesia to be used?
Each of the following is cited as an advantage of Amsorb over soda lime EXCEPT

options.label: C
options.text: More absorptive capacity per 100 g of granules

options.label: D
options.text: It does not contain NaOH or KOH

questions.correct_answer: C. More absorptive capacity per 100 g of granules

questions.text: Successful Stellate Ganglion Block signs all except
Which of the following opioid-receptor agonists has anticholinergic properties?
Shortest acting Muscle relaxant?
Which of the following muscle relaxants causes slight histamine release at two to three times the ED95 (effective dose in 95% of subjects) dose?
Each of the following drugs can enhance the neuromuscular blockade produced by nondepolarizing muscle relaxants EXCEPT
If etomidate were accidentally injected into a left-sided radial arterial line, the most appropriate step to take would be

A 25-year-old woman undergoes thyroidectomy under general anesthesia. Ondansetron 4 mg IV is administered as nausea prophylaxis. She complains of nausea in the recovery room. Which of the follow agents is LEAST likely to be of benefit to her for treatment (rescue) of postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV)?
Which drug is used post operatively to regain strength from muscular weakness?
Which of the following nerves is typically spared during performance of an interscalene brachial plexus block?
Modified Mallampatti classification used for?

options.label: A
options.text: Risk of difficult bag mask ventilation

options.label: B
options.text: Risk of injury to teeth during intubation

questions.correct_answer: B. Risk of injury to teeth during intubation

questions.text: What would be appropriate pre-operative investigations needed in a patient going for elective hernia surgery who has hypertension and is on ace inhibitor and has undergone Coronary Artery Bypass surgery 4 years back?
All the following agents are acceptable for use in a Bier block EXCEPT
Identify the capnogram?

options.label: B
options.text: Spontaneous breathing under the effect of muscle relaxation

questions.correct_answer: B. Spontaneous breathing under the effect of muscle relaxation

questions.text: A 58-year-old patient has severe shortness of breath and “wheezing.” On examination, the patient is found to have inspiratory and expiratory stridor. Further evaluation reveals marked extrinsic compression of the mid trachea by a tumor. The type of airflow at the point of obstruction within the trachea is
Concerning the patient in Question 1, administration of 70% helium in O2 instead of 100% O2 will decrease the resistance to airflow through the stenotic region within the trachea because

options.label: A
options.text: Helium decreases the viscosity of the gas mixture

options.label: B
options.text: Helium decreases the friction coefficient of the gas mixture

options.label: C
options.text: Helium decreases the density of the gas mixture

options.label: D
options.text: Helium increases the Reynolds number of the gas Mixture

questions.correct_answer: C. Helium decreases the density of the gas mixture

questions.text: Of the measures below, which is the LEAST useful in response to suspected VAE during a neurosurgical procedure in the upright position?

options.label: C
options.text: Placement of wax on cut bone edges

questions.correct_answer: A. Application of 10 cm H2O PEEP

questions.text: Anesthetic gas with maximum respiratory irritation

You are a day-care provider and find a 3-year-old child who is unresponsive. She had laid down for a nap because she was not feeling well. When you checked on her, she was not breathing and appeared blue. You are by yourself. What is the first step in managing this case?
questions.correct_answer: D. Deliver two minutes of CPR

questions.text: Which of the following is not cardio depressive?

A 23-year-old parturient in the first trimester is brought to the operating room for emergency appendectomy. General anesthesia is planned. Which of the following agents should be avoided while giving anesthesia in this patient?
Cisatracurium is preferred over atracurium because?

options.label: A
options.text: Less potent and so less laudonosine production

questions.text: A 1-year-old child with tetralogy of Fallot is to undergo elective repair of a left inguinal hernia under general anesthesia. Which of the following anesthetics would provide the MOST stable hemodynamics in this patient?
Anaesthetic which causes increased cerebral blood flow and decreased CMRO2 except:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Effect of anaesthetic agents on cerebral physiology:

questions.text: A 37-year-old patient with a history of manic-depressive illness is scheduled to undergo surgery for removal of an intramedullary rod in the left tibia. Which of the following statements regarding potential untoward effects of lithium therapy is NOT true?

options.label: A
options.text: Long-term administration may be associated with nephrogenic diabetes insipidus

options.label: B
options.text: Administration of succinylcholine to patients treated with lithium may result in hyperkalemia

options.label: C
options.text: Long-term therapy may be associated with hypothyroidism

options.label: D
options.text: Duration of action of vecuronium may be Prolonged

questions.correct_answer: B. Administration of succinylcholine to patients treated with lithium may result in hyperkalemia

questions.text: Differences in which of the following local anesthetic properties account for the fact that the onset of an epidural block with 3% 2-chloroprocaine is more rapid than 2% lidocaine?
Decreased ETCO2 is seen in all except
Through which of the following would a spinal needle NOT pass during a midline placement of a subarachnoid block in the L3-L4 lumbar space?
All of the following are true for Laryngeal Mask Airway except?

options.label: A
options.text: Can be used for positive pressure ventilation

options.label: C
options.text: Can be used for spontaneous breathing

questions.text: A 63-year-old man is scheduled to undergo a right hemicolectomy under general anesthesia. Anesthesia is induced with propofol 2 mg/kg IV and fentanyl 100 ?g IV. Succinylcholine 1.5 mg/kg IV is administered to facilitate tracheal intubation. Anesthesia is maintained with isoflurane and N2O. After all four twitches of the train-of-four stimulus return to baseline values, vecuronium 10 mg IV is administered. Gentamicin 80 mg and cefazolin 1 g are administered IV as a prophylactic treatment. At the end of surgery, two of four thumb twitches can be elicited to train of-four stimulation of the ulnar nerve, and neuromuscular blockade is antagonized with neostigmine 0.05 mg/kg IV and atropine 0.015 mg/kg IV. The patient, however, begins to move before the incision is completely closed, and succinylcholine 40 mg IV is given. Fifteen minutes later, all anesthetics are discontinued and the patient is ventilated with 100% O2, but the patient remains apneic. The most likely cause of apnea is
Which of the following statements regarding “TRAIN OF FOUR” stimulation is true except?

options.label: B
options.text: 4 stimuli given at a gap of 0.4 seconds

options.label: D
options.text: Duration between 2 tof stimulations must be minimum 10 secs

questions.correct_answer: B. 4 stimuli given at a gap of 0.4 seconds

questions.text: Succinylcholine is contraindicated for routine tracheal intubation in children because of an increased incidence of which of the following side effects?
Which of the following statements are true for Intercostal nerve block except?

options.label: A
options.text: Cause pain relief for longer time

options.label: C
options.text: Must be given in 2 or more segments

questions.correct_answer: A. Cause pain relief for longer time

questions.text: Person is under surgery for laryngeal malignancy, while ligating jugular vein he suddenly developed hypotension ventricular arrhythmia and sudden etco2 fall. Cause?
In a 6-year-old child, the length of an oral endotracheal tube (from the alveolar ridge to the midtrachea) most often is

A 5-year-old male twin presents with acute appendicitis. He is scheduled for an emergent appendectomy. His family history is significant for his twin brother suffering a malignant hyperthermia episode that led to a 2-week intensive care unit stay, but eventual recovery with treatment. Which of the following anesthetic drugs should be avoided in this patient?
Which among the following anesthetic agent is used in spinal anesthesia?
Epidural use of which of the following opioids would result in the GREATEST incidence of delayed respiratory depression?
Correct regarding difference between adult & paediatric resuscitation?

options.label: A
options.text: Respiratory causes of cardiac arrest are more common in paediatric patients

options.label: B
options.text: Response of the bystander in unwitnessed collapse in both adult and paediatric patient is same

options.label: C
options.text: The ratio of compression to ventilation is more for paediatric patient as compared to adults

options.label: D
options.text: Carotid is the preferred site of pulse check for both

questions.correct_answer: A. Respiratory causes of cardiac arrest are more common in paediatric patients

questions.text: A 69-year-old man with a history of diabetes mellitus and chronic renal failure is to undergo placement of a dialysis fistula under regional anesthesia. During needle manipulation for a supraclavicular brachial plexus block, the patient begins to cough and complain of chest pain and shortness of breath. The MOST likely diagnosis is
Which of the following types of regional anesthesia is associated with the GREATEST serum concentration of lidocaine?
Identify the image
True statements regarding inclusion of intrathecal morphine, fentanyl, or sufentanil in obstetric anesthesia practice include each of the following EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: The chief site of action is the substantia gelatinosa of the dorsal horn of the spinal column

options.label: B
options.text: There is no motor and no sympathetic blockade

options.label: C
options.text: Pain relief is adequate for the second stage of labor

options.label: D
options.text: Lipophilic narcotics are associated with less delayed respiratory depression than non-lipophilic narcotics

questions.correct_answer: C. Pain relief is adequate for the second stage of labor

questions.text: Not used for measuring cardiac output in an ICU patient is:

options.label: C
options.text: Thermodilution method in Pulmonary artery catheter

options.label: D
options.text: Continuous Cardiac output monitoring via pulmonary artery

questions.text: A 38-year-old primiparous patient with placenta previa and active vaginal bleeding arrives in the operating room with a systolic blood pressure of 85 mm Hg. A cesarean section is planned. The patient is lightheaded and scared. Which of the following anesthetic induction plans would be most appropriate for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Spinal anesthetic with 12 to 15 mg bupivacaine

options.label: B
options.text: General anesthetic induction with 2 to 2.8 mg/kg propofol and paralysis with 1 to 1.5 mg/kg succinylcholine

options.label: C
options.text: General anesthesia induction with 0.75 to 1 mg/kg ketamine and paralysis with 1 to 1.5 mg/kg succinylcholine

options.label: D
options.text: Replace lost blood volume first, then use any anesthetic the patient wishes

questions.correct_answer: C. General anesthesia induction with 0.75 to 1 mg/kg ketamine and paralysis with 1 to 1.5 mg/kg succinylcholine

questions.text: Arrange the following in decreasing order of MAC?

options.label: A
options.text: Nitrous oxide > xenon > desflurane > sevoflurane > isoflurane

options.label: C
options.text: Desflurane > sevoflurane > nitrous oxide > xenon > isoflurane

questions.correct_answer: A. Nitrous oxide > xenon > desflurane > sevoflurane > isoflurane

questions.text: Why are ventilations delivered to a pediatric arrest person before seeking assistance in single-rescuer scenarios?

options.label: C
options.text: Most pediatric cardiac arrests are due to respiratory arrest.

options.label: D
options.text: The use of an AED is contraindicated in pediatrics.

questions.correct_answer: C. Most pediatric cardiac arrests are due to respiratory arrest.

A 5-year-old child was undergoing squint surgery under general anesthesia with muscle relaxation and controlled ventilation. Suddenly 15 minutes into the surgery the patient’s heart rate changed from 123 bpm to 40 bpm and blood pressure changed from 90\50 mmhg to 50\32 mmhg. On noticing this change what will be your 1st step in the management of the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Deepen the plane of anesthesia by giving a bolus dose of propofol.

options.label: B
options.text: Immediately inform the surgeon to stop the surgery

questions.correct_answer: B. Immediately inform the surgeon to stop the surgery

options.label: A

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased lower esophageal sphincter tone

You are walking in the park and see an unconscious person. What is the next step that you will take?

options.label: A
options.text: Check Pulse, Start CPR, Call for help

options.label: B
options.text: Call for help, check pulse, start CPR

options.label: A
options.text: Activation of GABA receptors in brain

questions.text: A 62-year-old patient with a bare-metal stent in the mid portion of the left anterior descending artery is scheduled for rotator cuff repair under general anesthesia. The stent was placed 6 weeks before surgery and the patient is on dual therapy (aspirin and clopidogrel). Which of the paradigms below would be best for managing his anticoagulation before surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue both up to the day of surgery

options.label: B
options.text: Stop both 7 to 10 days before surgery

questions.correct_answer: D. Stop clopidogrel and continue aspirin

questions.text: True regarding LAST (local anesthetic systemic toxicity) is/are?

options.label: C
options.text: CNS depression is an early feature

questions.text: All of the following are true regarding anesthesia in obstetric patient except?

options.label: A
options.text: Epidural analgesia is contraindicated in HELLP patients

options.label: B
options.text: General anesthesia is always preferred in LSCS

options.label: C
options.text: Continuous ECG monitoring needed in obstetric anesthesia due to high risk of arrhythmias

options.label: D
options.text: Anesthetics need dose modification in concomitant surgery in obstetric patients

questions.correct_answer: B. General anesthesia is always preferred in LSCS

questions.text: The diagram of a correctly positioned proseal – type Laryngeal Mask Airway is provided below above What site is the arrow marked area of the airway positioned?

True regarding paediatric anaesthesiology?

options.label: A
options.text: Drug dose and airway size is calculated based upon the child’s weight

options.label: B
options.text: Spinal anesthesia is contraindicated below 6 months of age

options.label: C
options.text: Halothane is not a favoured agent in pediatric anesthesia

options.label: D
options.text: Most preferred mode of induction in pediatric patient is intravenous induction

questions.correct_answer: A. Drug dose and airway size is calculated based upon the child’s weight

questions.correct_answer: D. Penetration into the subarachnoid space
